curam.util.audit
Interface AuditLogInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
DisabledAudit
public interface AuditLogInterface

This interface provides the contract for storing audit information. Customers can use a standard Curam plug-in to audit information or can write their own version of the plug-in which implements this interface. A plug-in is specified by specifying a class name in the curam.custom.audit.writer application property and implementing this interface in that class.

Nested Class Summary
static class AuditLogInterface.OperationType
          An enumerated type describing the Database operations which can cause audit records to be produced.

Method Detail

auditMethodCall

void auditMethodCall(DateTime timeStamp,
                     java.lang.String userId,
                     java.lang.String programName,
                     TransactionInfo.TransactionType tranType)
                     throws AppException,
                            InformationalException
This method is called by the system when audit information was generated from an invocation of audit enabled business method.

Parameters:
timeStamp - The time at which the method was invoked.
userId - The user who invoked the method.
programName - The signature of the method which was invoked. This is in the form BPOName_MethodName (for example Users_checkSecurity).
tranType - The context in which the method was invoked. This may be one of batch, online, deferred and other.
Throws:
AppException - If an exception is thrown the transaction associated with the business method will be rolled back and no audit information will be logged.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

auditDataAccessCall

void auditDataAccessCall(DateTime timeStamp,
                         java.lang.String userId,
                         java.lang.String programName,
                         TransactionInfo.TransactionType tranType,
                         java.lang.String tableName,
                         java.lang.String keyRepresentation,
                         java.lang.String beforeRepresentation,
                         java.lang.String afterRepresentation,
                         AuditLogInterface.OperationType operationType)
                         throws AppException,
                                InformationalException
This method is called by the system when audit information was generated from an invocation of audit enabled database operation.

Parameters:
timeStamp - The time at which the database operation was invoked.
userId - The user who invoked the database operation.
programName - The signature of the database operation which was invoked. This is in the form BPOName_MethodName (for example Users_checkSecurity).
tranType - The context in which the method was invoked. This may be one of batch, online, deferred and other.
tableName - The name of the entity being audited.
keyRepresentation - An XML representation of the key that was used as part of the update operation. This is in the form 

  <STRUCT>
    <SNAME>Struct_Name</SNAME>
    <FIELD>
      <FNAME>Some_field_name</FNAME>
      <TYPE>java.lang.String</TYPE>
      <VALUE>Some_field_value</VALUE>
    </FIELD>
    <FIELD>
      <FNAME>Some_other_field_name</FNAME>
      <TYPE>java.lang.String</TYPE>
      <VALUE>Some_other_field_value</VALUE>
    </FIELD>
  </STRUCT>
The type setting is the java type (for example String or DateTime) that corresponds to the field,
beforeRepresentation - An XML representation of the the values of the various fields before they were updated as part of a data access. This may be an empty string or a string that follows the same format as the keyRepresentation.
afterRepresentation - An XML representation of the values of the various fields as they will be after they are updated as part of a data access. This may be an empty string or a string that follows the same format as the keyRepresentation.
operationType - The operation type that caused the audit record to be produced.
Throws:
AppException - If an exception is thrown the transaction associated with the business method will be rolled back and no audit information will be logged.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
